ul.li1: 1The righteous one perishes, and there is no one who takesOr “sets” it to heart.
ul.li2: And men of faithfulness are gathered, while there is no one who understands,
ul.li1: for the righteous is gathered from the presence of wickedness.
ul.li2: 2he enters into peace;
ul.li1: they will rest on their beds,
ul.li2: walking straight ahead of him.
ul.li1: 3“ButOr “And” you, come near here, you children of a soothsayer,
ul.li2: offspring of an adulterer and she who commits fornication.
ul.li1: 4At whom do you make fun?
ul.li2: At whom do you openLiterally “widen” your mouth and stick outLiterally “make long” your tongue?
ul.li1: Are you not children of transgression,
ul.li2: offspring of deception,
ul.li1: 5who burn with lust among the oaks,
ul.li2: under every leafy tree,
ul.li1: who slaughter children in the valleys,
ul.li2: under the clefts of the rocks?
ul.li1: 6Your portion is among the smooth stones of the valley;
ul.li2: they, they are your lot;
ul.li1: indeed, to them you have poured out a drink offering,
ul.li2: you have brought a food offering.

chapter.p: Shall I relent concerning these things?

ul.li1: 7You have set your bed upon a high and lofty mountain;
ul.li2: indeed, you went up there to slaughter sacrifice.
ul.li1: 8And you have set your symbol behind the door and the doorpost;
ul.li2: for you departThe reading tradition (Qere) has “uncover,” which makes no sense in context, but with different vowels it would be “depart” from me, and you go up;
ul.li1: you make your bed wide, and you make a deal withLiterally “cut off for yourself from” them,
ul.li2: you have loved their bed; you have seen their genitals.Literally “hand”
ul.li1: 9And you climbed down to the king with oil,
ul.li2: and you made your perfumes numerous,
ul.li1: and you sent your envoys far away,Literally “to from far”
ul.li2: and you sent down deepLiterally “humiliated” to Sheol.
ul.li1: 10You grow weary by the greatness of your way,
ul.li2: but you did not say, ‘Despairing!’
ul.li1: You found the renewalLiterally “life” of your strength,Literally “hand;” compare the “hand” in verse 8
ul.li2: therefore you do not grow weak.
ul.li1: 11And of whom were you afraid and feared, that you deceived
ul.li2: and did not remember me?
Did you not place it on your heart?
ul.li1: Have I not been silent, even from long ago,
ul.li2: and so you do not fear me?
ul.li1: 12I myself will declare your righteousness and your works,
ul.li2: butOr “and” they will not benefit you.
ul.li1: 13When you cry,Literally “your crying” let your collection deliver you,
ul.li2: and the wind will carry all of them away;
a breath will take them away.
ul.li1: ButOr “And” he who takes refuge in me shall take possession of the land,
ul.li2: and he shall inherit my holy mountain.”Literally “mountain of holiness “

ul.li1: 14And one shall say, “Build up, build up! Clear the way!
ul.li2: Remove the obstaclesHebrew “obstacle” from the way of my people!”

chapter.p: 15For thus says the high and lofty one who resides forever, and whose name is holy:

ul.li1: “I reside in a high and holy place,
ul.li2: and with the contriteLiterally “crushed” and humble of spirit,
ul.li1: to revive the spirit of the humble,
ul.li2: and to revive the heart of the contrite.Literally “crushed”
ul.li1: 16For I will not attack forever,
ul.li2: and I will not be angry forever,
ul.li1: for the spirit will grow faint before me,
ul.li2: and the breaths that I myself I have made.
ul.li1: 17I was angry because of his sin of gain, and I struck him;
ul.li2: I hid and I was angry, butOr “and” he walked apostate, in the waysHebrew “way” of his heart.
ul.li1: 18I have seen his ways, butOr “and” I will heal him;
ul.li2: and I will lead him and give him and his mourners comfort as a recompense,
19creating fruit of lips.
ul.li1: Peace, peace to the far and near,” says Yahweh, “and I will heal him.
20ButOr “And” the wicked are like the churning sea,
ul.li2: that is not able to keep quiet,
and its waters toss up mire and mud.
ul.li1: 21There is no peace,” says my God, “for the wicked.”
